title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, grant the Commission the ability to use matching funds for approved projects, and adjust personnel matters within the Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, grant the Commission the ability to use matching funds for approved projects, and adjust personnel matters within the Commission. Amendments include changes to member compensation and appointment regulations. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to appoint and terminate necessary personnel. Additionally, the Economic Development Committee section is revised to grant flexibility in decision-making by changing "shall" to "may". The Denali Commission is granted special functions under Section 3. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize the Secretary of Labor to make lump sum payments for a training program on careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program focuses on construction, operations, maintenance, management, and youth initiatives for Commission projects and public infrastructure. Amounts made available remain accessible until used. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes training for construction, operations, and maintenance for public infrastructure projects in rural Alaska. The Commission may provide assistance for teacher housing needs, including housing development activities like acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction. Amounts available to the Commission remain accessible until expended. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
